paragraphs.text: Tim is a seasoned Web Developer with 13 years professional experience. Currently he lives in Queens, NY and is working for WebMD as Senior Web Developer since May 2015. Technologies Tim has used at WebMD include HTML5, CSS3, Vanilla JavaScript, Node.js NPM, Grunt, RequireJS, SCSS, jQuery, Handlebars, Omniture (BI) and Akamai AMP Premier. Prior to WebMD, Tim worked at Time Inc as an HTML5 developer utilizing HTML5, CSS3, Vanilla JavaScript, Backbone.js, Handlebars, Underscore.js and Adobe DPS for developing webview storefronts on the iPad, iPhone and Kindle Fire. Tim has also upheld several development roles at the New York Post (Web Developer for 2 years) and at Acxiom Digital (Content Specialist and Solutions Developer for 5 years). While working full-time, Tim has worked as a Freelancer and Contractor on weekends and weeknights to improve his skillset.

paragraphs.name: Hobbies
paragraphs.text: video games, on/off/off-off broadway musicals, movies, music, books, building computers, web development

Forgot Password Email (mobile version)
Custom webview storefront. Separate code from iPad storefront. Latest issue in hero position along with back issues available in vertical scroll.
Details about the issue when tapping the issue cover from the storefront.

Library consisting of entitled issues purchased through the storefront, activated via print subscription, or entitled by other (online digital subscription without iTunes) means through login credentials.

Library consisting of issues to be purchased, downloaded, and viewed. The top horizontal section is a web viewer used for cross-selling to other brands and apps as well as advertising subscriptions, free samples, and special offers.
The storefront for People is unique in that it is the only brand using this design. The storefront lists the most current issue along with recent back issues to be purchased and downloaded.
This is a registration form used to create a digital account. A digital account allows you to sign-in to different apps (iPad / Kindle Fire) to access purchased issues and subscriptions.
The my account section allows the user to navigation through account management from 'forgot password' to 'terms of service' and 'privacy policies'.
Similar to the People storefront, this is the shared designed across other Time Inc brands on iPad.
Similar to the People storefront, this is the shared designed across other Time Inc brands on iPad.

Tapping a cover within the store that has not been downloaded, will open this preview. The preview provides a small example of what can be found within the issue, along with the option to purchase or download the issue.
First screen displayed. UX design helps user identify where to begin (subscribe digtally, browse issues, or access if you are a print subscriber).
Unique to the traditional Time Inc storefronts, this is a new look to experiment what encourages users to browse, subscribe or buy single copies.
Screenshot with a swipable UX to allow users to see what they are buying, before they commit to a purchase.

steps.text: Used by Ad Operations, this tool allows users to setup ad placements for different issues within the iPad app.
A dropdown list makes it easy for Ad Operations to find the issue they need to work in, or if they need to refer to a past "archived" issue.
Selecting the current or a future issue allows Ad Operations to start setting up new ads.
After creating ads, clicking "Save" will allow you to see the JSON object (as a string).
Here is a JSON object (as a string) that one could use for troubleshooting if there are any problems in the database.
Here is an inspection on an XHR to pull in an archived issue, producing one large JSON object with more details.

sections.name: Summary
sections.text: Over 13 years of progressive, comprehensive experience as an innovative web developing professional. A distinguished worker acknowledged for positive rapport among co-workers and clients. Detail oriented, with a proven ability to successfully contribute to company objectives. Well balanced workload of projects and tight deadlines in a fast paced environment. Aspiring to enhance skill set from cutting-edge technologies utilizing HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.

role.name: Senior Web Developer / Sponsorship + Revenue
items: Automated deployment builds with the use of Grunt and Node Package Manager (NPM).
Optimized video player code by reducing AMD module to make 1 HTTP request through requireJS optimization inside grunt build.
Implemented XSLT for transforming bulky XML from Documentum into HTML, JavaScript, Handlebars templates and other front-end formats.
Integrated various AMD modules for use within an editorial CMS.
Primary developer for revenue and sponsorship video player (Akamai AMP Premier v63) used across WebMD website.
Built a fully responsive framework, reducing program setup time by 40%, thus removing the need for a separate mobile-process.
Technical documentation provided for implementing modules within PageBuilder CMS for editorial team.
Provide support to teams outside of IT which include publishing, product owners, PPM, Ad Ops, and Beacon (Omniture team).

role.name: Consulting Engineer / Consumer Marketing + Revenue
items: Knowledge transfer of codebase, documentation and environment setup to off-shore team.
Fixed merge conflicts in Git Repository by off-shore, post hand-off.

role.name: Front-End Developer / Consumer Marketing + Revenue
items: Coordinated with QA testers for end-to-end unit testing and post-production testing.
Supervised the work of 2 other front-end developers.
Updated, modified and expanded existing iOS web applications.
Trained 3 equipment operators, data entry and user personnel.
Developed web applications for Apple iPad/iPhone and Kindle Fire platforms.
Developed Time For Kids Classroom application with student / teacher web views and classroom assessments.
Developed a responsive jQuery mini magazine web-based reader for marketing to replace a minimally supported Adobe Flash reader.
Provided technical and development support to marketing JavaScript advertisements used across all Time Inc. brands.
Implemented a custom filter to determine special issues from weekly / monthly issues not native to the Adobe DPS APIs.
Produced reusable Omniture code to deliver descriptive user actions and page views for readable and effective reporting in SiteCatalyst.
Managed and perfected special messaging to end-users during the release of iOS8 to keep app ratings substantial and customer service complaints minimal.
Implemented A/B testing, manipulating DOM elements using local storage.
Setup an automated posting script to pass data to the back-end for used for delivering audience segmented push notifications called ECHO.
Transitioned Woodwing applications on iPad into a highly configurable Backbone application utilizing the latest Adobe DPS JavaScript APIs.

role.name: Web Developer / Online Production
items: Planned and executed changes to both iPhone and Android mobile applications.
Troubleshooted and resolved web application issues escalated from customer support and other departments with a 100% success rate.
Built internal web tools for ad placement within mobile applications.
Created HTML email templates and newsletters for e-mail marketing campaigns.
Executed and monitored standards for user interfaces, page design and graphics development.
Compiled statistical information for special reports. (Omniture / Chartbeat / Newsbeat)
Designed templates for the CMS to promote SEO and conversion best practices and the efficient use of HTML tags.
Managed all social media programs, including Internet forums, blogs, social networking applications and message boards.

role.name: Content Specialist Lead / Solutions Developer
items: Designed dynamic microsites for start-up clients and multi-national corporations.
Produced engaging email marketing campaigns with user segmentation and personalization.
Accomplished in optimizing graphics and web-safe colors for fast download time.
Produced high quality work with recognition of 12+ months error-free and close attention to detail.
Implemented a JavaScript search API for a leading hotel chain.
Created support documentation for web and data projects.
Automated a B2B solution using Oracle PL/SQL stored procedures to subscribe and unsubscribe ~5K member per day.
Developed an ASP API to subscribe new members based off a preference center submission and triggering an automated confirmation email.

role.name: Service Desk Support Professional
items: Demonstrated effective and consistent technical support.
Implemented procedures which provided the tools to automate a testing process.
Performed troubleshooting of computer systems and related equipment.

role.name: Desktop Support Team (Internship)
role.items: Provided base level technical support to faculty, staff, and students.
